body_html:
@usamaoDATA

I'm going to guess that you tried to comment out the lines in the lipo commands. You must delete those lines instead. The problem is that the lipo command is multi-line:

lipo \
  ${LIBDIR}/iossim_386/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  # ${LIBDIR}/iossim_x86_64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7s/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  -create \
  -output ${LIBDIR}/libprotobuf-lite.a

so if you comment out a line in the middle, the \ characters at the end cause all these lines to be considered one, so it ends up being interpreted as:

lipo ${LIBDIR}/iossim_386/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a # ${LIBDIR}/iossim_x86_64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7s/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a -create -output ${LIBDIR}/libprotobuf-lite.a

which means the trailing command line arguments are considered commented out as well, so you get the error you saw about missing required options.

So, just delete those lines instead & it should work.

lipo \

so if you comment out a line in the middle, the \ characters at the end cause all these lines to be considered one, so it ends up being interpreted as:

which means the trailing command line arguments are considered commented out as well, so you get the error you saw about missing required options.
So, just delete those lines instead & it should work.
body:
@usamaoDATA 

I'm going to guess that you tried to comment out the lines in the lipo commands.  You must delete those lines instead.  The problem is that the lipo command is multi-line:

```
lipo \
  ${LIBDIR}/iossim_386/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  # ${LIBDIR}/iossim_x86_64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7s/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a \
  -create \
  -output ${LIBDIR}/libprotobuf-lite.a
```

so if you comment out a line in the middle, the `\` characters at the end cause all these lines to be considered one, so it ends up being interpreted as:

`lipo ${LIBDIR}/iossim_386/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a # ${LIBDIR}/iossim_x86_64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm7s/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a ${LIBDIR}/ios_arm64/lib/libprotobuf-lite.a -create -output ${LIBDIR}/libprotobuf-lite.a`

which means the trailing command line arguments are considered commented out as well, so you get the error you saw about missing required options.

So, just delete those lines instead & it should work.
